An agent sent the secret number using RSA, but chose both primes as Blum integers. The intercepted ciphertext is below. Can you recover the message? 4300458293794657860047124598138030064561979618794991880715134581820081843343874806349157513174782449309468525251695812418734376493659584739076423188606757

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6914834475064108036507076279964508258516849093823696082835473580636466120175133064738726769954560047432990270881510822472079528833760191347780882984856133, e=3355724388201861716999049625387514295682894801644357218489594772676399258272592234393681434056634732399792387598411413799807359669282209723572640624855629
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84247969633882235766702428999090567875

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{x5a9412p}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4300458293794657860047124598138030064561979618794991880715134581820081843343874806349157513174782449309468525251695812418734376493659584739076423188606757
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6914834475064108036507076279964508258516849093823696082835473580636466120175133064738726769954560047432990270881510822472079528833760191347780882984856133, e=3355724388201861716999049625387514295682894801644357218489594772676399258272592234393681434056634732399792387598411413799807359669282209723572640624855629
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84247969633882235766702428999090567875

extra_info: p=79736349164148839181996359327756093501506976639209984837723254156657612159683, q=86721232506255313849060955644033901207348665856608915382250016554090534168151, Ï†(n)=6914834475064108036507076279964508258516849093823696082835473580636466120174966607157056365801528990118018480886801966829583709933540218077070134838528300
